question.text:
Read the statements given below:
(i) The first movements of the foetus and appearance of hair on the head are usually observed during 5th months of pregnancy.
(ii) The structural and functional unit between developing embryo and the maternal body is called the umbilical cord.
(iii) At puberty, in female both ovaries contain about 60,000 – 80,000 primary follicles.

Choose the correct statement from the above.

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>,</mo></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></math>

solution.text:
The structural and functional unit between developing embryo and maternal body is called placenta which is connected to the embryo through an umbilical cord.
At puberty, in female each ovary contain about 60,000 – 80,000 primary follicles.
